pr_title: Improve tracing capability of m2e through m2e.logback.configuration.

timeline.message:
Improve tracing capability of m2e through m2e.logback.configuration.

- Add 'org.eclipse.m2e.logback.feature' to target platform
- Add 'org.eclipse.m2e.logback' plugin to language server product
- This exposes the 'logback.configurationFile' system property through
  which one can provide a logback configuration

Signed-off-by: Roland Grunberg <rgrunber@redhat.com>

Improve tracing capability of m2e through m2e.logback.configuration.

- Add 'org.eclipse.m2e.logback.feature' to target platform
- Add 'org.eclipse.m2e.logback' plugin to language server product
- When system property 'jdt.ls.debug=true' is set (eg. by
  java.jdt.ls.vmargs), and 'logback.configurationFile' is not set ,
  verbose (DEBUG) logging will be done on the standard output of JDT-LS.
- The system property 'logback.configurationFile' is also available for
  advanced debugging usages

Signed-off-by: Roland Grunberg <rgrunber@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText:
The launch file is supposed to add all required bundles explicitly, you have to add all dependencies from logback to the launch file.
<setEntry value="ch.qos.logback.classic@default:default"/>
<setEntry value="ch.qos.logback.core@default:default"/>
<setEntry value="ch.qos.logback.slf4j@default:default"/>
timeline.author: testforstephen

replies.bodyText: Added. I checked with the 'valid plug-ins' button in the run configuration to confirm there are no resolution issues.
replies.author: rgrunber
